events.title: Ambas Bay Settlement Founded
events.description: Alfred Saker establishes the Ambas Bay Settlement with capital at Victoria, marking the first formal British presence in the territory.

events.title: German Protectorate Declared
events.description: Germany declares Kamerun a protectorate under the Treaty of Protection with Douala chiefs, initiating colonial administration over the territory.

events.title: Partition of Kamerun
events.description: Anglo-French forces defeat Germany. The territory is partitioned by the Picot-Milner Agreement into British and French spheres of administration.

events.title: League of Nations Mandate
events.description: British Cameroons becomes a mandated territory under the League of Nations, administered as part of British Nigeria under a Class B mandate.

events.title: UN Trusteeship Agreement
events.description: Southern British Cameroons becomes a United Nations Trust Territory under United Kingdom administration, establishing international obligations and a framework for self-determination.

events.title: UN-Supervised Plebiscite
events.description: A United Nations-supervised plebiscite results in the southern zone voting for federation with the Republic of Cameroun. The Southern Cameroons Independence Constitution provides the constitutional framework for this union.

events.title: Federal Structure Dissolved
events.description: A referendum replaces the Federal Republic of Cameroon with a unitary state, the Republic of Cameroon. The constitutional arrangement agreed at federation is thereby abrogated.

events.title: Bamenda High Court Proceedings
events.description: Legal challenges before the Bamenda High Court assert the constitutional continuity of Southern Cameroons statehood and contest the legality of the 1972 dissolution of the federal structure.
